sentence.text: The expression profile of positive regulation of G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle-20 in human breast carcinoma was undertaken by real-time PCR using RNA isolated from malignant tumors, nonneoplastic mammary tissue, and breast cancer cell lines to identify altered regulation that may have potential pathogenetic and prognostic significance.

entity.text: positive regulation of G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle

sentence.text: Our studies show that seven of the ADAMTS genes (positive regulation of G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle, 3, 5, 8, 9, 10, and 18) are consistently down-regulated in breast carcinomas with respect to nonneoplastic mammary tissue, irrespective of the heterogeneity of the samples and the tumor muscle organ development or grade (Mann-Whitney U test, P < 0.0001 for each gene).

entity.text: positive regulation of G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle

sentence.text: positive regulation of G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle5 has emerged as being an independent predictor of survival, with RNA expression levels significantly lower (P = 0.007) in grade 3 breast carcinoma compared with grade 1 and 2 breast carcinoma

entity.text: positive regulation of G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle
